name: A Wine Bottle Painting Workshop
description: Paint your own wine bottle masterpiece in this fun, hands-on workshop perfect for all skill levels! You'll get to design and decorate a full-size bottle using vibrant acrylics, all while enjoying good vibes, snacks, and warm drinks in a cozy studio setting. A creative, giftable, and totally unique.

name: Original Haunted Walk of Toronto

location.name: Hockey Hall of Fame - Tour Start Location

description: Join us on a chilling and thrilling journey through the dark history of the city as we delve into the world of ghosts, graveyards, hangings, and haunts. Prepare to be captivated by spine-tingling ghost stories about haunted theatres, unsolved mysteries, secrets hiding in plain sight, and spooky historic buildings. Our outdoor tour will take you on a hair-raising paranormal adventure, departing from the courtyard in front of the Hockey Hall of Fame. Get ready to see the city in a whole new light, or rather, darkness, as you uncover the eerie and supernatural tales that lurk in its shadows.

name: Spirits of the Distillery District Ghost Tour

location.name: Tour starts inside the front gates of the Distillery District

description: As night falls, we'll set out on a lantern-lit stroll along the cobblestone streets of the historic Distillery District – one of Toronto's most haunted spots! Learn about the tragic events that left their mark and hear spine-chilling tales of paranormal encounters from this iconic area. Feel the goosebumps rise as you explore the narrow alleyways and hidden corners where spirits are said to lurk. Whether you're a history buff, a ghost enthusiast, or just looking for a unique experience, this outdoor tour is sure to captivate your imagination. Get ready to experience the thrills and chills of the Distillery District like never before.
image: https://secure.toronto.ca/webapps/CC/fileAPI/edc_eventcal/Ghosts and Spirits of the Distillery 2024 copy_fo5nqxSLgnZIcbv_4F58FQ.jpg

name: A Taste of Hong Kong
description: Jackie Z welcomes you to A Taste of Hong Kong. Come join Jackie for a snack-sized tasting class of Hong Kong's best treats! Jackie will introduce you to famous foods such as curry fish balls, siu mai, and more, while sharing the highlights and history of Hong Kong. All the way from its colonial era to the present, this class will give you an intimate look at the pride and determination of Hong Kong people.

name: Community Environment Day at Downsview Park
description:
Join Councillor Pasternak (Ward 6) and the City of Toronto to help reduce the amount of waste going to landfill. Drop off household items for donation, electronics for reuse or recycling and household hazardous waste for proper disposal. 

Pick up free bagged compost while supplies last and kitchen catchers for organics ($7 each – cash, debit and credit accepted).

name: Christina Leslie | Pinhole Portraits and Places
description: Our first solo exhibition of work by Christina Leslie (Canadian-Jamaican, b. 1983). Pinhole Portraits and Places brings together several bodies of work produced from including Pinhole Remix (2017–2020), Pinhole Places (2022–2025), and Pinhole Parishes (2023–2025). Pinhole Portraits and Places expands on Leslie's recurring themes of decolonization, identity, migration, marginalization, and heritage, while combining historical photographic techniques and contemporary methodologies.

name: Brahms & Bruch
description: Join us for an evening of romantic classical music. Featuring conductor Sarah John and soloist Sarah de Niverville on viola the orchestra will be presenting Brahms' Symphony No. 1 in C minor and Bruch's Romanze for Viola.
